subject: Art & Design
title: Depth of Field: Sharp vs. Blurry Backgrounds
description: A 60-second lesson on Depth of Field: Sharp vs. Blurry Backgrounds.

hook.text: A portrait with a creamy blurred background feels professional. A snapshot with everything sharp feels casual.

buildup.text: Depth of field (DOF) is how much of the scene is in focus. Shallow DOF blurs backgrounds.

discovery.text: A wider aperture (lower f-number) creates shallower DOF. That's the 'portrait mode' effect.

twist.text: Landscapes want deep DOF â€” everything sharp. Portraits want shallow DOF â€” subject isolated.

climax.text: Phone cameras simulate DOF digitally. Understanding the real optics helps you control the simulation.

punchline.text: Blur isn't a flaw. It's a composition tool.

quiz.question: What creates a blurry background in photography?
options: A wide aperture (low f-number) creating shallow depth of field
